intro: Tephrosia salicifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, willow-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tephrosia salicifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its growth habit and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
